Docs.summary: A builder abstraction for configuring instances.
Docs.remarks: The is registered in the service collection as a transient service. Callers should retrieve a new instance for each to be created. Implementors should expect each instance to be used a single time.

Docs.param: An instance of to operate at the bottom of the handler chain and actually handle the HTTP transport operations.

An ordered list of instances to be invoked as part of sending an and receiving an . The handlers are invoked in a top-down fashion. That is, the first entry is invoked first for an outbound request message but last for an inbound response message.
Docs.summary: Constructs an instance of by chaining one after another with in the end of the chain. The resulting pipeline is used by infrastructure to create instances with customized message handlers. The resulting pipeline can also be accessed by using instead of .
Docs.exception:
contains a entry.
-or-
DelegatingHandler.InnerHandler is not . DelegatingHandler instances provided to HttpMessageHandlerBuilder must not be reused or cached.

Docs.remarks: The is set by the infrastructure and is public for unit testing purposes only. Setting the outside of testing scenarios may have unpredictable results.

Docs.summary: Gets an which can be used to resolve services from the dependency injection container.
Docs.remarks: This property is sensitive to the value of . If this property will be a reference to the application's root service provider. If (default) this will be a reference to a scoped service provider that has the same lifetime as the handler being created.
